main event: A bright ruby-colored light was observed in the sky over Wayzata, Minnesota on July 27, 1967.
interesting points: The object appeared to stand still, did not move, and flashed in a rapid, apparently random pattern.
The object grew dim and eventually flickered out, but would periodically become visible again.
The observer reported that the object was brighter than the brightest stars and had sharply outlined edges.
The observer received reports of similar objects being seen by another person in the area on January 1 of the same year.
The observer requested the Air Force's opinion on what the object might have been and asked for the report to be forwarded to the University of Colorado and Mr. Condon.
sighted object: A bright, ruby-colored light in the sky
witnesses: A 17-year-old male, his mother, and his father
photographs: No photographs were included in the report
